meanings.sent1: The constant noise from the construction site nettled the residents.
meanings.sent2: The loud music from the party next door nettled me as I tried to study.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel nettled the dog by stealing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The persistent buzzing of the fly nettled her like a pesky mosquito.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive tapping on the keyboard nettled him more than anything else.

meanings.definition: Feeling or showing irritation or annoyance
meanings.sent1: She had a nettled expression on her face after the argument.
meanings.sent2: The nettled customer complained about the slow service at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: His nettled reaction to the prank made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The nettled cat arched its back and hissed at the approaching dog.
meanings.sent5: The nettled tone in her voice indicated she was not in the mood for jokes.
